title: VPN and Virus software
content: Fire fox says it blocks spyware and virus attempts. Do I actually need a VPN or other virus detection software in conjunction with fire fox browser to be safe?
creator: jacobstz

title: Automatic Updates
content: When I am using firefox, it often updates without need nor request of my consent, whenever this happens, I become unable to use firefox whatsoever until it is shut down and restarted completely, losing me all my private windows and any un-finalized data entered in my non-private pages. This is unacceptable to me, and I have tried to turn it off in settings, however, under the "firefox updates" heading, it only lists a version number. It seems that it used to have an option to force requests for updates, but it's no longer there. I have also read that others used that option but while it requested consent, it went ahead anyway until told no. It doesn't take a recontextualization into a legal or sexual scenario to see how scummy this behavior is, as it is readily apparent. If this kind of "windows 10" style update is all mozilla can offer me, I will happily switch to ungoogled chromium, however if there is a way to make it so updates can only happen when I click yes on update then I would much prefer to stick with firefox as it has been my favored browser for my entire life. Any help is much appreciated, thank you for your time.
creator: Tedbluefire

title: "a web page is slowing down your browser" what would you like to do?
content: I am soooo annoyed, this has been happening for a few months now and I have looked high and low for a fix. It's NOT my graphics card, it happens on almost every page, no matter if I have 2 tabs open or 10. It is ridiculous that I can't find a fix. I am just about too find another browser, even though I have used Firefox for many years, I am sick of this. I have tried resetting my entire Firefox, uninstalling and re installing (which is a nightmare, because although it is "supposed" to save he settings, it doesn't save them all, in fact it only saves my bookmarks!) clearing all cache, cookies, history and everything else I can think of. This started all at once, never once did I have this issue before one of the updates! Can anyone please help? I will give it another shot before getting rid of Firefox. But not much longer. By the way, this is not happening on my Android phone or Tablet. Thanks in advance, Diana

creator: sites1

title: Amazon allowed to change my password in Firefox?
content:
On four occasions during the past three months, Amazon has refused my log in to their site, stating that I've not used the correct password. When this occurs, I look at my 'password box' and can see that the number of characters (the black dots) are of a far greater number than the number of characters in my current password by more than 200. When I go to 'Security' in Firefox to view my password, it has indeed changed to a random selection of 200 plus characters. When I erase these characters and retype my original password, Amazon will accept the change and I can log in.

My question: Although I don't expect anyone to know why Amazon is doing this, I'm baffled as to how Firefox can be manipulated by Amazon so as to change my password.

Has anyone experienced this and is there any advice? I'm hopeful that an actual Amazon tech will have a response to this as well as the community.

Thank you,

Placerville
creator: Placerville

creator: valentin.morin

title: Why was disabling the "check for updates" "feature" disabled?
content:
Ever since evolving past the 70's version, "Print to PDF" from Firefox has had sporadic problems. I have now three times "upgraded" to various 80's series releases and though sometimes Print to PDF works, it more often fails. Once again i have "downgraded" to a 70's release, and i do not experience flaws.

I have posted at least twice of the issue, yet no one is able, or has done anything, about it. Fine. But to keep getting that annoying "New version available" notification is as irritating as malware, especially since "upgrading" will cause the system to malfunction, and the choice to spend time by your programmers to eliminate a safe internal method to disable this is very confusing; why was the decision made to eliminate the option to turn that annoyance off, creating an annoyance when the only time one would turn upgrades off would be when there was a malfunction with a release?

I did find the external registry fix, which, compared to pre early 60's releases having the setting, was a waste of my time to find, but more importantly, added an outside element of a breach of security. I do not understand the reasoning in the development team's thought process.
creator: bem67

title: Necesito una PERSONA de Mozilla que me responda, porque he probado la solución y no funciona
content:
Me aparece el famoso error: No se ha conectado: Posible problema de seguridad

Firefox ha detectado una potencial amenaza de seguridad y no ha continuado a www.google.com porque este sitio web requiere una conexión segura.

¿Qué puede hacer al respecto?

www.google.com tiene una política de seguridad llamada HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), que significa que Firefox solo puede conectarse a él de forma segura. No puede añadir una excepción para visitar este sitio.

El problema está probablemente en el sitio web, y no hay nada que pueda hacer para resolverlo.

Si está en una red corporativa o utilizando un antivirus, puede ponerse en contacto con el equipo de asistencia para obtener ayuda. También puede notificar el problema al administrador del sitio web.

Código de error: SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER


Que te lleva a esta página de solución: https://support.mozilla.org/es/kb/La%20conexi%C3%B3n%20segura%20ha%20fallado?as=u&utm_source=inproduct

NO funciona lo que hago con windows 10 home, incluso ya actualicé el windows (hablé con un agente de windows y me dijo que el tema es firefox)

NECESITO ayuda de alguien que realmente sepa guiarme porque sino desinstalaré el navegador, porque solo me pasa con mozilla y en esta computadora.

title: Firefox >79 slow to load pages

I've upgraded to 82.0.2 and the same thing is happening. Tried going back using system restore, but system restore failed for some reason, so I'm now stuck. title: How to disable AutoUpdate
content:
Hi there,

Every time Firefox updates it crashes the work that I am doing on my websites and I have to restart again. In occassions, it makes my extension to stop working properly, which is more annoying cause Firefox is just a tool and the extensions are the only reason why I stay in Firefox and I do not switch to Chrome.

In the past, you could select when to update, that is I updated when I wanted and I had time and not in the middle of a process or line of daily tasks.

I have Ubuntu, and I select the repositories that I want to update everytime. It is time consuming, but I do not want to risk that Lastpass stop working and I have to look for other ways to findout my passwords.

Is there anyway to disable update in Firefox as it was in the past and made me very happy?

This post https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1199816 opted as solution "There is no reason to use an old version of Firefox"... well, congratulations for not thinking on your clients, that is a terrible response cause to take the power of your users to update whenever they want and take it for yourself.

Anyway, I will switch to Chrome as it does not autoupdate unless I want. Thanks

Thanks, 

                Carlos

title: Firefox browser works intermittantly
content: Hi, I have used Firefox on my desktop pc using Windows o/s many years with minimal problem. Last few weeks Firefox operating strangely. Starts off fine then after opening a few tabs will not open others. Seems to be searching for new url but no show. When I close it down to re-open fresh a pop-up box appears with option 'close firefox'. Only when selected will firefox re-open. That then works fine for a few tabs then will not open after that. I have tried Refresh, Restart without add-ins, Safe mode. None have removed the problem. I have thought about Uninstall then reinstall a 'clean' firefox, but worried about losing all my data. The problem seems to have started a few weeks back after a Windows 10 update but I am not sure about that. Any help gratefully received. Thanks.
